Havens of Gondor focuses on the great fief called Dor-en-Ernil
column2: the "Land of the Prince." Comprising all the lands between the rivers Gilrain and Ringlo/Morthond and including the whole of the hilly peninsula called Belfalas
column3: it is a strategic province blessed with fine ports and fair weather. It lies in the heart of southern Gondor and
column5: it is the westernmost of the Stone-land's wellsettled regions.

column2: the princely city of Dol Amroth and nearby Elven port of Edhellond
column3: are both in Dor-en-Ernil. Undoubtedly the most dramatic harbors in the South Kingdom
column4: their history embodies the grander tale of the Gondorian seafarers and their Elven friends
column5: and it mirrors the struggles of the region's oft-times warring peoples.

column2: Dor-en-Ernil is home to many lesser havens
column3: including the fine harborage at Linhir. Together these towns house many of Gondor's seamen
column4: and virtually all the ships which do not weigh anchor in the three maritime towns along the Anduin River: the great port-city of Pelargir
column6: and Osgiliath. Dor-en-Ernil's ports also provide a major portion of the warcraft engaged in the struggle against the Corsairs of Umbar and Harad.
